pull_requests.title: feat: user preferences API
pull_requests.description: Adds CRUD endpoints for user preferences including theme, notifications, and privacy settings.
pull_requests.author: Sarah Williams

pull_requests.title: feat: onboarding flow redesign
pull_requests.description: Complete redesign of user onboarding with new tutorial screens, progress indicator, and skip option.
pull_requests.author: Jamie Park

comments.author: Sarah Williams
comments.body: Nice work! One thing - make sure to add null checks for the carousel items. If a user has no saved state, this could crash.

comments.author: Sarah Williams
comments.body:
DO: Use the useCallback hook here to prevent unnecessary re-renders.
DON'T: Create new function instances on every render.

pull_requests.title: fix: add retry queue for payment webhooks
pull_requests.description: Fixes payment webhook failures by adding Redis-based retry mechanism with exponential backoff.
pull_requests.author: Sarah Williams

comments.author: Marcus Chen
comments.body:
DO: Always set a max retry limit to prevent infinite loops.
DON'T: Retry immediately - use exponential backoff to avoid hammering the service.

pull_requests.title: chore: migrate dashboard charts to Recharts
pull_requests.description: Migrates all dashboard charts from Chart.js to Recharts for better React integration and smaller bundle size.
pull_requests.author: Alex Rodriguez

comments.author: Jamie Park
comments.body: The tooltip positioning looks off on mobile. Can you add responsive breakpoints?

comments.author: Alex Rodriguez
comments.body: Good catch! Fixed with ResponsiveContainer wrapper.

pull_requests.title: fix: JWT token expiry configuration
pull_requests.description: Fixes JWT expiry set to 5 minutes instead of 24 hours due to debug config committed by mistake.
pull_requests.author: Sarah Williams

comments.author: Marcus Chen
comments.body:
DO: Add validation to catch unreasonable TTL values (e.g., < 1 hour or > 30 days).
DON'T: Commit debug/test configurations to the repo.

pull_requests.title: feat: add dark mode support
pull_requests.description: Implements system-wide dark mode with CSS variables and theme toggle component.
pull_requests.author: Jamie Park

comments.author: Alex Rodriguez
comments.body:
DO: Use CSS custom properties for colors so they cascade properly.
DON'T: Hard-code color values in component styles - always reference the theme variables.

comments.author: Alex Rodriguez
comments.body: Consider adding prefers-color-scheme media query for automatic OS-level detection.

pull_requests.title: feat: CSV export with async generation
pull_requests.description: Adds CSV export feature with async processing for large datasets. Files stored in S3 with email notification.
pull_requests.author: Sarah Williams

comments.author: Alex Rodriguez
comments.body:
DO: Stream large files to avoid memory issues. The chunking approach here is good.
DON'T: Load entire dataset into memory before writing to CSV.

comments.author: Alex Rodriguez
comments.body: Nice! The progress tracking would be a great follow-up feature.

pull_requests.title: feat: implement rate limiting middleware
pull_requests.description: Adds configurable rate limiting middleware with Redis backend for distributed tracking.
pull_requests.author: Sarah Williams

comments.author: Marcus Chen
comments.body:
DO: Use sliding window algorithm for smoother rate limiting.
DON'T: Use fixed windows - they allow burst traffic at window boundaries.

pull_requests.title: feat: notification preferences settings page
pull_requests.description: Adds settings page for managing notification preferences with real-time save.
pull_requests.author: Alex Rodriguez

pull_requests.title: feat: add API versioning support
pull_requests.description: Implements API versioning via URL path (/api/v1/, /api/v2/) with backward compatibility.
pull_requests.author: Sarah Williams

comments.author: Marcus Chen
comments.body:
DO: Document breaking changes clearly when bumping versions.
DON'T: Remove deprecated endpoints without a deprecation period (min 3 months).

pull_requests.title: perf: dashboard query optimization
pull_requests.description: Fixes N+1 query issue on dashboard. Batches widget queries and adds Redis caching.
pull_requests.author: Sarah Williams

comments.author: Marcus Chen
comments.body:
DO: Use select_related/prefetch_related (or equivalent) to batch DB queries.
DON'T: Make database calls inside loops - this is the classic N+1 pattern.

comments.author: Marcus Chen
comments.body: Great improvement! Load time from 15s to 1.2s is huge.

pull_requests.title: feat: in-app notification center
pull_requests.description: Adds notification bell with dropdown showing recent notifications, mark-as-read, and real-time updates.
pull_requests.author: Jamie Park

comments.author: Alex Rodriguez
comments.body:
DO: Use virtualization for long notification lists to keep performance smooth.
DON'T: Render all notifications at once - lazy load as user scrolls.

pull_requests.title: feat: implement webhook signature verification
pull_requests.description: Adds HMAC signature verification for incoming webhooks to prevent tampering.
pull_requests.author: Sarah Williams

comments.author: Marcus Chen
comments.body:
DO: Use constant-time comparison for signature verification to prevent timing attacks.
DON'T: Use regular string comparison (==) for secrets.

pull_requests.title: fix: SES rate limiting
pull_requests.description: Adds application-level rate limiting for transactional emails to prevent hitting AWS SES limits.
pull_requests.author: Sarah Williams

pull_requests.title: feat: bulk data import
pull_requests.description: Bulk import feature supporting CSV and JSON with validation, progress bar, and rollback on failure.
pull_requests.author: Sarah Williams

comments.author: Marcus Chen
comments.body:
DO: Validate file contents before processing. Check headers, data types, required fields.
DON'T: Trust user input - always sanitize and validate imported data.

comments.author: Alex Rodriguez
comments.body: The drag-and-drop UI is really slick! Nice touch with the file type icons.

pull_requests.title: fix: iOS app null pointer crash
pull_requests.description: Hotfix for iOS app crashing on launch due to null pointer in onboarding carousel.
pull_requests.author: Jamie Park

comments.author: Alex Rodriguez
comments.body:
DO: Always use optional binding (if let, guard let) when accessing potentially nil values.
DON'T: Force unwrap optionals with ! - this is what caused the crash.

pull_requests.title: feat: add audit logging
pull_requests.description: Implements comprehensive audit logging for security-sensitive operations.
pull_requests.author: Sarah Williams

comments.author: Marcus Chen
comments.body:
DO: Log WHO did WHAT, WHEN, and from WHERE (IP, user agent).
DON'T: Log sensitive data like passwords, tokens, or PII in audit logs.

pull_requests.title: feat: search autocomplete and fuzzy matching
pull_requests.description: Enhances search with autocomplete suggestions and typo tolerance using Elasticsearch.
pull_requests.author: Alex Rodriguez

comments.author: Sarah Williams
comments.body:
DO: Debounce search requests (300ms is good) to avoid overwhelming the server.
DON'T: Fire a request on every keystroke.

pull_requests.title: fix: elasticsearch reindex and monitoring
pull_requests.description: Fixes stale search results by triggering reindex and adds cluster health monitoring.
pull_requests.author: Sarah Williams

pull_requests.title: feat: add request tracing with correlation IDs
pull_requests.description: Implements distributed tracing with correlation IDs that flow through all services and logs.
pull_requests.author: Sarah Williams

comments.author: Marcus Chen
comments.body:
DO: Pass correlation ID in all outgoing HTTP requests via X-Correlation-ID header.
DON'T: Generate new IDs for each service - propagate the original ID through the chain.

pull_requests.title: security: fix rate limit bypass vulnerability
pull_requests.description: Fixes security vulnerability where rate limiting could be bypassed by spoofing X-Forwarded-For header.
pull_requests.author: Sarah Williams

comments.author: Marcus Chen
comments.body:
DO: Maintain an allowlist of trusted proxy IPs and only accept X-Forwarded-For from those.
DON'T: Trust client-provided headers blindly - they can be spoofed.

pull_requests.title: feat: SSO integration (SAML + OIDC)
pull_requests.description: Full SSO support for enterprise customers with SAML 2.0 and OIDC, including user auto-provisioning.
pull_requests.author: Sarah Williams

comments.author: Marcus Chen
comments.body:
DO: Validate SAML assertions thoroughly - check signature, timestamps, audience, issuer.
DON'T: Skip validation steps even in development - security bugs love to ship this way.

comments.author: Marcus Chen
comments.body: Excellent documentation on the setup process! This will save a lot of support tickets.

pull_requests.title: fix: database connection pool exhaustion
pull_requests.description: Fixes 503 errors during traffic spike by adding PgBouncer and increasing connection pool size.
pull_requests.author: Sarah Williams

comments.author: Marcus Chen
comments.body:
DO: Use connection pooling (PgBouncer) for production databases.
DON'T: Let each app instance manage its own connections - this doesn't scale.

pull_requests.title: fix: nginx file upload size limit
pull_requests.description: Fixes file upload limit reset to 5MB by updating nginx config and adding to Terraform.
pull_requests.author: Sarah Williams

comments.author: Alex Rodriguez
comments.body:
DO: Keep infrastructure config in version control (Terraform, Ansible, etc.).
DON'T: Make manual changes to servers - they get lost on redeploy.

pull_requests.title: feat: advanced search filters
pull_requests.description: Adds advanced filtering options to search including date range, status, tags, and custom fields.
pull_requests.author: Alex Rodriguez

comments.author: Jamie Park
comments.body: Love the URL serialization for shareable filtered searches! The filter chips look great too.

pull_requests.title: feat: mobile dark mode
pull_requests.description: Adds dark mode support to iOS and Android apps with system preference detection.
pull_requests.author: Jamie Park

comments.author: Alex Rodriguez
comments.body:
DO: Test dark mode with actual dark backgrounds - some colors that look fine in light mode become unreadable.
DON'T: Just invert colors - design for each theme intentionally.
